name: fracture
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something hard, such as a bone, fractures, or is fractured, it breaks or cracks: fracture someone's skull She fractured her skull in the accident. Two of her ribs fractured when she was thrown from her horse. A fractured pipe at a steelworks has leaked 20 tons of oil into the Severn estuary.

formal to divide an organization or society, or (of an organization or society) to be divided: Intense disagreement over economic policy risks fracturing the coalition government.

to crack or break something, esp. a bone: [ T ] She fractured her skull in the accident. [ I ] This mineral fractures along straight lines.
a crack or break, esp. in a bone: He had a hairline fracture (= a thin crack in the bone) of the toe.
earth science Fracture is also the way that a particular kind of rock usually breaks, or the shape of broken pieces.
